articles.title: 5 Minutes a Day to Healthier Blood Pressure – Here’s How - SciTechDaily
articles.description: A study from UCL and the University of Sydney reveals that minor daily exercises, like stair climbing, may lower blood pressure. Replacing just five minutes of inactivity with movement showed potential for reducing hypertension-related risks, supporting manag…
articles.content:
Researchers show that small exercise bursts—such as stair climbing—may reduce blood pressure, offering a simple way to manage cardiovascular risks.
